cab.content: (THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OP HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY1S GOVERMKEKT) SECRET.CP. 189 (39). COPY NO. ^cabinet.REPRESENTATION OF BRITISH INTERESTS IN ENEMY COUNTRIES.Note "by the Secretary.The attached documents are circulated, for the information of the Cabinet, at the request of the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.(Signed) E.E. BRIDGES.Secretary to the Cabinet.Richmond Terrace, S.W. 1, 1st September, 1939. *5 kj 0The Under-Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs presents his compliments to the Secretary to the Cahinet, and is directed toy the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to inform him that arrangements have already "been made, with the approval of the Prime Minister and the Secretary of State for Domi Affairs, to approach the United States Government with a request that they should take charge of British interests in the enemy countries/ country,2, A decision by the Cabinet will therefore not toe necessary, tout the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs will toe glad if his colleagues in the cabinet may he informed of the arrangements made.Foreign Office, S.W.1, 1st September, 1939. MOST IMMEDIATE.The Under Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs presents his compliments to the Secretary to the Cabinet and is directed by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs to state that His Majesty's Ambassador at Washington has been instructed by telegram to request the United States Government to undertake the protection of British sublets in Germany and that His Majesty's Ambassador at Berlin has been notified accordingly by telegraph. ,Foreign Office, S.W.1, 1st September, 1939.
